body: @javierluraschi @kevinykuo Do you have any feedback on this?

Do you run mlflow v1 on all involved components? Because this version was [released a year ago](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/tree/1.0.0) and I can imagine that either the bug was fixed already or caused by version incompatibilities. And as discussed in #3077, maybe also with the fact that you are pre-assigning an ID. I admit that this is a speculation 😄.

@lorenzwalthert thanks for your response.
Below is the code we are running.After replacing ```run_uuid``` with ```run_id``` as per your suggestion in [3077](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3077)
```Sys.setenv(PATH=paste0('/opt/conda/bin:', Sys.getenv('PATH')))
library(reticulate)
use_condaenv('mlflowtest5')
#mlflow::install_mlflow()
library(mlflow)
library(glmnet)
library(carrier)
client <- mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
mlflow_create_experiment("bicky/test_example227", artifact_location = '/home/ealiasbi/mlflow', client = client)
with(mlflow_start_run(),{
  #pick experiment id from the pervious step and replace in the next step
  run1= mlflow_start_run(experiment_id=59,client=client)
  mlflow_log_param("parameter", 5, run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
  #mlflow_log_metric("metric", 0, run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
  #mlflow_log_artifact("test.txt", artifact_path = '/home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt', run_id = run1$run_id, client = client)

})
```
The latest error we see is 
```
Error in UseMethod("mlflow_id") : 
  no applicable method for 'mlflow_id' applied to an object of class "c('tbl_df', 'tbl', 'data.frame')"
```
Earlier my assumption was this error is caused by ```mlflow_log_artifact```.However when calling ```mlflow_log_param``` alone by commenting other calls,it throws the same error.


Also to your question _*Do you run mlflow v1 on all involved components*_
can you please clarify what exactly do you mean?
On the mlflow server we have installed mlflow version 1.9.1
```/opt/conda/bin/pip install mlflow==1.9.1```
and on RStudio env when we do we install mlflow lib to our env
by doing ```mlflow::install_mlflow()``` it installs 1.0.0 by default.

``` mlflow::install_mlflow()
Collecting mlflow==1.0.0
```
Is there any other way to use upgraded versions of R apis if thats what you meant?This [document](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/R-api.html#) doesnt clarify that.
Any help on this is much appreciated.

Regards,
Bicky

> Also to your question Do you run mlflow v1 on all involved components
can you please clarify what exactly do you mean?

Well the version of the R and conda binary should correspond, i.e. when getting the R package version 1.9.1 from CRAN and you run `mlflow::install_mlflow()`, you should see 
```
Collecting mlflow==1.9.1
```
Which is not what you see.

I also don't see why you are using `with()` above. I think this is used in mlflow Python, but I haven't seen this in the R API. And as I said, I don't think you can pre-assign IDs like `59`.

HI @dmatrix thanks for your response.

Am only using an experiment id that is generated from the previous step of creating the experiment
Also I removed the ```with``` block and below is my updated code.
```Sys.setenv(PATH=paste0('/home/ealiasbi/.conda/envs/mlflow_test6/bin/python:', Sys.getenv('PATH')))
Sys.setenv(MLFLOW_PYTHON_BIN='/home/ealiasbi/.conda/envs/mlflow_test6/bin/python')
library(reticulate)
use_condaenv('mlflow_test6')
packageurl <- "https://artifactory.ai.cba:443/artifactory/static/ai/aiaa/rstudio-server-pro/mlflow_1.9.0.tar.gz"
install.packages(packageurl, repos=NULL, type="source")
packageVersion('mlflow')
library(mlflow)
library(glmnet)
library(carrier)
client <- mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
exp_id=mlflow_create_experiment("bicky/test_examplesample122", artifact_location = '/home/ealiasbi/mlflow', client = client)
run1= mlflow_start_run(experiment_id=exp_id,client=client)
mlflow_log_param("parameter", 5, run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
mlflow_log_metric("metric", 0, run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
mlflow_log_artifact("/home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt", artifact_path = '/home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt',run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
```
Added python bin path to MLFLOW_PYTHON_BIN as per [this](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/R-api.html#install-mlflow) documentation.
After the above changes, 

1. mlflow_log_param works fine
2. mlflow_log_metric works fine
3. mlflow_log_artifact fails with below error
  ```
  File "/home/ealiasbi/.conda/envs/r-mlflow-1.0.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/file_store.py", line 396, in _get_run_info
    databricks_pb2.RESOURCE_DOES_NOT_EXIST)
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Run '4a2f3e382fa547e6909d652b95b313f1' not found
Error in run(mlflow_bin, args = unlist(args), echo = echo, echo_cmd = verbose,  : 
  System command error
```
 However am not sure why it complains the ```Run '4a2f3e382fa547e6909d652b95b313f1'``` is missing as you can see in the attached screenshot on MLFlow tracking UI,the runid in question is existing for this experiment.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16069726/87839124-c44d9300-c8dc-11ea-8ae9-d71074b49401.png)


also as per [this](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/R-api.html#mlflow-log-artifact) i tried to omit ```client_id ``` and ```run_id``` and just call 
```mlflow_log_artifact("/home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt", artifact_path = '/home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt')```
It fails with the errror
```Error in wait_for(function() mlflow_rest("experiments", "list", client = client),  : 
  Operation failed after waiting for 10 seconds"
```

Am also not disregarding your comment on version consistency.
I have installed mflow 1.9.0 from source . **I could not find 1.9.1 on CRAN** Not sure if that matters??(1.9.1 on conda vs 1.9.0 on R)?
``` 
packageVersion('mlflow')
[1] ‘1.9.0’
```
conda package version :
```
mlflow                    1.9.1 
```

 So clearly its the issue of binding experiment to a run id for uploading artifacts.Is there any suggestions on how I can change the code to bind them differently?

From 
> File "/home/ealiasbi/.conda/envs/r-mlflow-1.0.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/file_store.py", line 396, in _get_run_info
  databricks_pb2.RESOURCE_DOES_NOT_EXIST)
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Run '4a2f3e382fa547e6909d652b95b313f1' not found
Error in run(mlflow_bin, args = unlist(args), echo = echo, echo_cmd = verbose,  : 
System command error

We can see that you use the r-mlflow-1.0.0 environment, which is a hint that the version used is not 1.9.1 here. I’d remove this conda  env if it does not contain anything you want to keep. 

Also, 1.9.0 aus 1.9.1 does probably not matter in terms of compatibility, but 1.0.0 and 1.9.0 probably does.

Also I am not sure why you use an absolute path as the target directory for the artifact. I think this should be relative, since the file will be logged somewhere under your run id -> artifacts -> relative dir (depending also on which storage backend you use, but logic is similar). Try just the file name for `artifact_path` instead of an absolute path.

@lorenzwalthert thanks for your reference.
I changed the code to remove reference from conda env.
```
Sys.setenv(MLFLOW_PYTHON_BIN='/home/ealiasbi/.conda/envs/mflow11/bin/python')
library(reticulate)
use_condaenv('mflow11')
library(mlflow)
library(glmnet)
library(carrier)
client <- mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
exp_id=mlflow_create_experiment("bicky/test_examplesample130", artifact_location = '/home/ealiasbi/mlflow', client = client)
run1= mlflow_start_run(experiment_id=exp_id,client=client)
mlflow_log_param("parameter", 5, run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
mlflow_log_metric("metric", 0, run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
mlflow_log_artifact("/home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt", artifact_path = 'test.txt',run_id=run1$run_id, client=client)
```
Currently getting a whole different error- which I think is a progress :).Moving to same versions on R and conda has helped to git rid of the previous errors.
```
Error in process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdout, stderr,  : 
  processx error: 'No such file or directory' at unix/processx.c:378
```
As per recommendation I have passed only the file name to the artifact path.However the issue is in the first parameter.
As per[this](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/R-api.html#mlflow-log-artifact).Its not clear what should be the path.
The path in question is pretty much existing on the disk.
```
(mlflow11) ealiasbi@rstudio:~/bicky/Mflow_withoutConda$ ls -ltr /home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt
-rwx------+ 1 ealiasbi domain users 17 Jul  7 12:04 /home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt
```
I think this is an open issue as per [this](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/1009)

Can you use the [reprex](https://reprex.tidyverse.org) package so we see where exactly which error occurs? Ideally, we don't change the example for reproducibility and keep it minimal. In your code, you don't create the file `"/home/ealiasbi/mflow/test.txt"`, and I don't know if you created it earlier, but it must exist (to stick to the reprex philosophy, I create it in the below code so it should be reproducible). I.e. you can't log an artifact that you have not yet created.

Also, you example contains a lot of code that is not required here. I dropped it. I usually log artifacts to a temp directory and then it works. 

The `client` and the `run_id` arguments are taken from the active run if not specified, so you can simplify:
``` r
library(mlflow)
# client <- mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
client <- mlflow_client()
exp_id <- mlflow_create_experiment(paste0("bicky/test_exp", digest::digest(Sys.time())), client = client)
run1 <- mlflow_start_run(experiment_id = exp_id, client = client)
# client and run_id are taken from the active run
mlflow_log_param("parameter", 5)
mlflow_log_metric("metric", 0)
tmp <- tempdir()
artifact <- "mlflow-test.txt" # sees not to work when placed outside working directory, e.g. artifact <- "~/mlflowow-test"
path_before_logged <- fs::path(tmp, artifact)
writeLines(letters, path_before_logged)
mlflow_log_artifact(path_before_logged, artifact_path = "test.txt")
#> 2020/07/19 08:52:10 INFO mlflow.store.artifact.cli: Logged artifact from local file /var/folders/6g/bg5mcmsj7s51r33snbxhm1400000gn/T/RtmpR8pMLz/mlflow-test.txt to artifact_path=test.txt
#> Root URI: /private/var/folders/6g/bg5mcmsj7s51r33snbxhm1400000gn/T/RtmpipOW1Z/reprex1441e7f16cadc/mlruns/0/6d88fc7767cf47279cbbdbefe0122191/artifacts
```

<sup>Created on 2020-07-19 by the [reprex package](https://reprex.tidyverse.org) (v0.3.0)</sup>

Can you verify that this works fo your (just re-run it?). Now if you comment out `client <- mlflow_client()` and uncomment `# client <- mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")`, you have pretty much what you want I think. I hope it still works for you after that.

Sidenote: The path expansion with `~` is not performed apparently in `mlflow_log_artifact()`, which should be a separate issue, so you need `path.expand("~")`  for now if you want to log from the home directory.

but still getting the same error as before,i.e writing to tmp is not helping the cause.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16069726/87870765-8771c100-c9ee-11ea-8fbe-9040e320541f.png)

I want to clarify one thing that **my MFLOW tracker server is not on the same host.Its a remote server sitting behind an nginx proxy.** Am not sure if thats worth considering.

Also,isnt this an acknowledged [bug](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/1009).
@lorenzwalthert any thoughts on how to proceed further?

I think it's important to distinguish the two backends according to the [docs](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#mlflow-tracking-servers):

- artifact store (defaults to local file system, can be S3 or similar)
- backend store (defaults to file system, can be a data base)

Can you verify that the parameters are logged correctly before tackling the artifact problem? Because according to the link above, the tracking uri should be something like `<dialect>+<driver>://<username>:<password>@<host>:<port>/<database>`, you have `"https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443"` (and I was not sure if you put this to hide your credentials or if you were really using this URL).

If you are running the above code locally, the arifact store should just be your local `mlruns` directory, but if you are running that in the cloud, maybe this does not work and you could try to specify an S3 backend (I remember seeing some databricks error above) when you create the experiment, like `mlflow::mlflow_create_experiment("YourExperiment", "s3://bucket/path")`. Note that you need to have an AWS account with the privliedges for S3 described in the above docs and either the aws cli tools or the env variables configured to provide your credentials to mlflow.

Also, from your code above, I can't conclude if the code runs successfully if you use the default client (i.e. a local backend store). Can you confirm this, i.e. in your code above, use

```r
# client <- mlflow_client(tracking_uri = "https://backend-mlflow-server.aiaa.ai.cba:4443")
client <- mlflow_client()
```
